verses.text: 愛 神謹守祂的誡命「以下是耶和華你們的 神吩咐我教導你們的誡命、律例、典章，使你們在將要過去佔領為業的地上遵行，

words.note: An ideographic space used to show reverence for God.
When referring to the singular God of Israel, often capitalized.
A reverent form of '他' (he/him) used for divine beings.
An ideographic space used to show reverence for God.
When referring to the singular God of Israel, often capitalized.

verses.text: 好叫你和你的子子孫孫一生一世敬畏耶和華你的 神，遵守他的一切律例、誡命，就是我吩咐你的，使你的日子可以長久。

words.note: An ideographic space used to show reverence for God.
When referring to the singular God of Israel, often capitalized.
Refers to God in this context.

verses.text: 以色列啊，你要聽從，就謹守遵行，使你在流奶與蜜的地可以享福，人數大大增多，像耶和華你列祖的 神應許你的。

words.note: An ideographic space used to show reverence for God.
When referring to the singular God of Israel, often capitalized.

verses.text: 「以色列啊，你要聽，耶和華我們的 神是獨一的耶和華；

words.note: An ideographic space used to show reverence for God.
When referring to the singular God of Israel, often capitalized.

verses.heading: The Essence of the Covenant Principles

verses.text: 你要全心、全性、全力愛耶和華你的 神。

words.note: An ideographic space used to show reverence for God.
When referring to the singular God of Israel, often capitalized.

verses.text: 我今日吩咐你的這些話，都要記在你的心上；

words.note: Lit. 'on heart'

verses.heading: Exhortation to Teach the Covenant Principles

verses.text: 你要把這些話不斷地教訓你的兒女，無論你坐在家裡，或行在路上，或躺下，或起來的時候，都要談論。

words.note: Lit. 'not stopping'
Lit. 'on road'

verses.text: 你也要把這些話繫在手上作記號，戴在額上作頭帶。

words.note: Lit. 'on hand'
Lit. 'on forehead'

verses.text: 又要寫在你房屋的門柱上和城門上。

words.note: Lit. 'on door pillars'
Lit. 'on city gates'

verses.text: 、敬拜別的神「耶和華你的 神領你進入他向你列祖亞伯拉罕、以撒、雅各起誓應許給你的地；那裡有不是你建造的，又高大又美麗的城市，

words.note: Capitalized '神' often refers to the one true God.

verses.heading: Exhortation to Worship the \nd Lord\nd* Exclusively

verses.text: 有裝滿各樣美物的房子，不是你裝滿的；有鑿成的水池，不是你鑿成的；還有葡萄園和橄欖園，不是你栽種的；你可以吃，並且吃得飽足。

words.note: Often refers to good provisions or blessings.
Specifically refers to shaping or creating by chiseling or digging.
Often refers to water reservoirs in biblical contexts.

words.definition: also have, in addition there are

words.note: A common feature of ancient agricultural societies in the Middle East.
Olive trees were a staple crop and symbol of prosperity in ancient Israel.
Refers to being completely satisfied with food.

verses.text: 那時，你要謹慎，免得你忘記了耶和華，就是把你從埃及地，從為奴之家領出來的那一位。

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Refers to the country of Egypt.
Describes the state of being enslaved.
Literary equivalent of '的', often found in classical or biblical texts.
A common phrase in the Exodus narrative.
Refers respectfully to 'that one' (God).

verses.text: 你要敬畏耶和華你的 神，要事奉他，奉他的名起誓。

words.note: Refers to a respectful, reverent fear of God.
Refers to the singular, true God. The character 神 is often bolded in Chinese Bibles.
Implies devoted service and worship, especially to a deity or lord.

words.definition: in the name of, to respect
words.note: Often used in formal or religious contexts to mean 'by order of' or 'in the name of'.
To make a solemn promise, often invoking a divine witness.

verses.text: 不可隨從別的神，就是你們周圍各民族的神；

words.note: A strong prohibition.
Implies allegiance and imitation, especially in religious contexts.
Refers to false gods or pagan deities.
Refers to the pagan deities of surrounding nations.

verses.text: 因為在你們中間的耶和華你們的 神，是忌邪的 神，恐怕耶和華你的 神向你發怒，就把你從這地上消滅。

words.note: Refers to the singular, true God.

breakdown.m: to be jealous of, to envy

words.note: Biblically, refers to God's zealous intolerance of idolatry and unfaithfulness, not human envy.
Refers to the singular, true God.
Refers to the singular, true God.
Often describes divine wrath in the Bible.
Often used in the context of complete destruction or eradication, especially by divine judgment.

verses.text: 「你們不可試探耶和華你們的 神，像你們在瑪撒試探他一樣。

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
The leading space is an honorific indicator for God in some Bibles.
A place in the wilderness where Israel tested God (Exodus 17:7).

verses.heading: Exhortation to Obey the \nd \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* Exclusively

verses.text: 要謹慎遵守耶和華你們的 神吩咐你的誡命、法度和律例。

words.note: The leading space is an honorific indicator for God in some Bibles.
Often used for divine commands or moral precepts.
Refers to legal measures or regulations.
Refers to rules or precedents of law.

verses.text: 耶和華看為正為好的事，你都要去行，使你可以享福，並且可以進去佔領耶和華向你的列祖起誓應許的那美地，

words.note: Refers to the ancient fathers or founders of a lineage.
Refers to the Promised Land given to Israel.

verses.text: 照著耶和華說過的，把你所有的仇敵從你面前趕逐出去。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb, indicating its disposal.

verses.text: 「日後，如果你的兒子問你：『耶和華我們的 神吩咐的這法度、律例和典章，有甚麼意思呢？』

words.note: The leading space is an honorific indicator for God in some Bibles.
Refers to established rules or regulations, often solemn.

verses.heading: Exhortation to Remember the Past

verses.text: 你就要對你的兒子說：『我們在埃及曾經作過法老的奴僕，耶和華卻用大能把我們從埃及領了出來。
耶和華在我們眼前，把又偉大又厲害的神蹟奇事行在埃及、法老和他全家的身上；
卻把我們從那裡領出來，為要領我們進入他向我們列祖起誓應許的地，要把這地賜給我們。
耶和華又吩咐我們遵行這一切律例，敬畏耶和華我們的 神，使我們常常得享福樂，使我們的生命得著保全，像今日一樣。

words.note: Refers to the one true God, hence capitalized.
Here, implies 'to be preserved' or 'to achieve preservation'.

verses.text: 我們在耶和華我們的 神面前，如果照著他吩咐我們的，謹守遵行這一切誡命，這就是我們的義了。』」

words.note: Refers to the one true God, hence capitalized.
